Bush's reckless remarks condemned abroad 
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The permanent secretariat of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization issued a statement on March 6 condemning bush for making reckless remarks against the DPRK during his Asia tour.
 The statement said that his remarks, in essence, came out of his constitutional discontent with the political system of the DPRK, as commented by the world public, not because of some "weapons" or "terrorism".    
 His remarks are a defilement upon the national feelings of the Korean people and little short of a declaration denying the dialogue with the DPRK, the statement said, expressing support and solidarity with the Korean people's efforts to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

Kim Yong Nam receives credentials from Uzbek ambassador
    Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Ismatilla Irgashev, newly appointed Uzbek ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of foreign affairs.    
 The president had a conversation with the ambassador.
